WOW. That is Insane & horrifying. And this happened in Atlanta...? That is pretty outrageous, a bit surprising, but sadly not too surprising. It's nice that folks are catching on to arrogant ignorance Finally in 2017, though it is still a bit mind-boggling. Is this simply due to feeling like you dont have enough power/agency that you have to go out & attack total strangers based on irrelevant things like one's physicality to buoy yourself up in comparison? That is of course, pretty tragic & very pathetic. The anchor's response was so dignified, & it's awesome to see her co-workers & station fully back her up & stand alongside her. It's also "nice" to hear she used the actual word; saying "the n-word" in response to gross hate speech really detaches itself from the visceral response people have to the term ie how this terrible person used it, as a weapon meant to inflict deep harm.
